intro: Galium mahadivense, commonly known as Mahadiv grass-penny. It is a flowering plant native to the Maldives, typically found in coastal and sandy areas. The plant has small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are opposite, simple, and often hairy. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants. Galium mahadivense is adapted to saline and arid conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
